messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: Deana/Magic
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s probably the Usborne Book of Magic Tricks, if you re talking that type of magic. Kingfisher makes a good one, too. Amy Kagey
messages.messageBody:
> My 13 year old dd is into magic. One of the best books we found is by
> Usborne but I can't remember the title and don't know where the books are at
> this time (I dare not venture into the dungeon of my dd's room!).

It's probably the Usborne Book of Magic Tricks, if you're talking that type
of magic. Kingfisher makes a good one, too.
Amy Kagey
<A HREF="http://www.ubah.com/ecommerce/default.asp?sid=Z0939&gid=1684902">my Usborne Books website!</A>

messages.subject: Re: Deana/Magic
messages.msgSnippet:
Deana, My 13 year old dd is into magic.  One of the best books we found is by
Usborne but I can t remember the title and don t know where the books are at
this
messages.messageBody:
Deana,
My 13 year old dd is into magic. One of the best books we found is by
Usborne but I can't remember the title and don't know where the books are at
this time (I dare not venture into the dungeon of my dd's room!). You can
search for the book at the Usborne website. Or try the public library.
There are lots of books available. I do not know of any organizations.
Sorry.
Peace,
Sarah

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
